vehicles.description: A white sedan is driving ahead of the ego vehicle, staying in the same lane.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle dictates the speed and following distance required for the ego car.

traffic cones.description: A series of blue and white traffic cones positioned on the left side of the ego car's lane, indicating a merge or shift to the right.
traffic cones.explanation: The cones suggest that part of the lane ahead may be closed or there are road works, requiring the ego car to adjust its lateral position correspondingly.

barriers.description: A continuous white concrete barrier on the left-hand side of the road from the ego car's perspective, preventing any crossing of traffic from the oncoming lanes.
barriers.explanation: The barrier ensures there is no oncoming traffic in the ego car's lane and delineates the separation between opposing traffic lanes.

barriers.description: High concrete median barrier on the right separating opposite lanes of traffic.
barriers.explanation: This barrier prevents any crossing into oncoming traffic, limiting the ego vehicle's options for lateral movement.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the current traffic image, the ego vehicle is following a white sedan which is directly ahead in the same lane. The presence of this vehicle is important as it determines the speed and following distance the ego car must maintain.

Additionally, the ego car is alerted to a change in the road conditions by a series of blue and white traffic cones on the left side. These cones indicate that the ego car should merge or shift to the right, possibly due to a part of the lane ahead being closed or the presence of road works.

On the left side of the road, there is a continuous white concrete barrier that ensures the ego car will not encounter any oncoming traffic and helps maintain a clear distinction between the directions of traffic. Similarly, on the right, a high concrete median barrier is present, confirming the separation of opposite lanes of traffic and restricting the ego car from any lateral movement into oncoming lanes.

There are no reported vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic lights, or other objects affecting the driving behavior in the image.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, generally made out of a thermoplastic or rubber material and designed to be highly visible. It is often used to mark areas of the road that are under construction, potentially hazardous, or where traffic needs to be directed away from a certain point. In this driving scenario, the cone signals the driver of the ego car to remain in the current traffic lane and not to drive or swerve into the area blocked off by the cones. This may indicate road works ahead or an obstruction on the roadside that requires drivers to steer clear for safety.

2.description and explanation: A traffic cone is a cone-shaped marker that is placed on roads or footpaths to temporarily redirect traffic in a safe manner. It is often used to create separation or merge lanes during road construction projects or when part of the road is closed for utility work or an accident. Upon seeing the traffic cone, drivers should become alert to potential hazards or changes in driving patterns ahead and be prepared to adjust their driving path as necessary, often by reducing speed and moving away from the cone to avoid the section of road it is marking.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the white sedan ahead, adjusting speed as needed. Prepare to steer slightly to the right to avoid the traffic cones and stay in the lane as indicated by the lane markings and cones. Continually monitor the road for any changes in traffic flow or additional road users not currently visible. Do not attempt to overtake due to the presence of traffic cones and the concrete barrier on the left side.
